email_content:
Hi Michael,

I’ve finished my read-through of the new draft and wanted to share a few quick thoughts:

• Character work: The development arc for the central characters feels much richer now. Their motivations come through clearly, and the way you handle the more intricate relationship dynamics is particularly effective.

• Narrative flow: Overall the structure is solid, but the momentum eases up a bit in the third act. Trimming or streamlining a scene or two there—or tightening some of the transitional beats—could help sustain the tension you’ve built.

I’m happy to discuss any of this in more depth or jot down line-level notes if that would be helpful. Let me know what you think and whether you’d like to set up a call.

Great work on this draft—I’m excited to see where it goes next.

Best,
Jane
sensitive_items: They seem to be speaking different emotional languages, which is draining.
relationship problems related to her marriage of Jane and her husband
